newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian euthanasia doctor kills himself, son says.
newsitem.headline: Italian euthanasia doctor kills himself, son says.

text.p: A doctor who championed the right of Italian women to have abortions and subsequently promoted euthanasia has killed himself, his son said on Tuesday.
Giorgio Conciani, 67, was found hanging on Monday night at his home in the Tuscan town of Fiesole, near Florence.

"I expected this at any time. He had often said that he would kill himself and I believe that a man's ideas should be respected," Conciani's son, Ferruccio, 28, said. He added that his father had been suffering from a debilitating illness.
Conciani had spent his life promoting the right to abortion in Italy, a country where the powerful Roman Catholic church considers it a sin, and also championed euthanasia.

He was briefly imprisoned in 1975 for performing illegal abortions and was struck off as a practising doctor in 1995 after being accused of helping a terminally ill patient to die by administering a cocktail of lethal drugs.
Abortion now is legal in Italy but euthanasia is still outlawed.
Ferruccio Conciani said his father hanged himself because he believed it was a more certain way of dying. "In any case, his illness prevented him from going to the chemist," he added.
